children.comment: Truthful Factoid: Some hippy products claim that Red Bull still uses Ox Bile to collect its Taurine.
Biological Fact: Taurine does not contain a Carboxyl group so technically it isn't an amino acid, despite being described as one!
Factual Truth:  Taurine is found in every single animal tissue, with a higher concentraion in bile, which is where it was first identified.
Fun factoid: Taurine is deliciously nutritious and probably won't give you cancer

children.author: NinjaGoaty
children.comment: I don't agree with bloodsports in general (even boxing), so I suppose I see it a little differently, but I maintain it should be stopped.
It's more of a bloodsport. Torture typically involves no risk to one party, while Matadors are under considerable risk.
progression and abolition of torture in any form (because really that's what it is) is more important.

children.author: NinjaGoaty
children.comment: It's also no small matter to kill innocent animals for entertainment. I appreciate it's a big part of the culture, but I also feel
no small matter to kill a part of a culture which has existed for millennia.

children.author: IMadeAnAccountJustToWriteThis
children.comment: sport is older than anything the Conquistadors found in the new world. Ending bullfighting seems like the right thing to do >now< but it's
Human sacrifices were traditional in many cultures, but that's not ok any more. Tradition doesn't make barbarism any more acceptable.

children.author: javima85
IMadeAnAccountJustToWriteThis
javima85
children.comment: I think we don't use that word in Spain. We use just animal brutality, but you are right.
By definition it is a bloodsport, like dog fighting or boxing. But yes, it is often considered a performance.
It's not a sport. They consider it is like going to the theatre or to a dancing performance.
In Spain it's actually protected as part of their cultural history - having been a local sport for thousands of years.
